SNYK_CC_TF_240.issue: Cloud Storage uniform bucket-level access is not enabled
references: CIS Google Cloud Platform Foundation v1.1.0 - 5.2 Ensure that Cloud Storage buckets have uniform bucket-level access enabled
SNYK_CC_TF_240.title: Uniform bucket-level access disabled

SNYK_CC_TF_241.impact: Instance can be accessed remotely over public Internet
SNYK_CC_TF_241.issue: Public IP will be assigned to the compute instance
references: CIS Google Cloud Platform Foundation v1.1.0 - 4.9 Ensure that Compute instances do not have public IP addresses
SNYK_CC_TF_241.title: Public IP assigned to compute instance

SNYK_CC_TF_242.impact: Database can be accessed remotely over public Internet
SNYK_CC_TF_242.issue: Public IP will be assigned to the SQL database
references: CIS Google Cloud Platform Foundation v1.1.0 - 6.6 Ensure that Cloud SQL database instances do not have public IPs
SNYK_CC_TF_242.title: Public IP assigned to SQL database instance

SNYK_CC_TF_31.impact: That potentially everyone can access your resource
SNYK_CC_TF_31.issue: That inbound traffic is allowed to a resource from any source instead of a restricted range
SNYK_CC_TF_31.resolve: Set source_range to specific IP range only, e.g. `192.168.1.0/24`
SNYK_CC_TF_31.title: GCP App Engine Firewall Rule allows public access

SNYK_CC_TF_32.impact: That potentially everyone can access your resource
SNYK_CC_TF_32.issue: That inbound traffic is allowed to a resource from any source instead of a restricted range
SNYK_CC_TF_32.resolve: Set source_ranges to specific IP range only, e.g. `192.168.1.0/24`
SNYK_CC_TF_32.title: GCP Compute Firewall allows public access

SNYK_CC_TF_83.impact: The ABAC may conflict with RBAC authorization and lead to unintended access violations
SNYK_CC_TF_83.issue: The legacy ABAC authorization is enabled on the cluster
SNYK_CC_TF_83.resolve: Set `enable_legacy_abac` attribute to `false`, or remove the attribute
SNYK_CC_TF_83.title: Legacy ABAC is enabled

SNYK_CC_TF_84.impact: The pods may be able to access sensitive information from node's metadata service
SNYK_CC_TF_84.issue: The Workload Identity is not enabled
SNYK_CC_TF_84.title: GKE Workload Identity is disabled

SNYK_CC_TF_85.impact: The legacy endpoints do not enforce metadata query headers, and can leak sensitive information
SNYK_CC_TF_85.title: GKE legacy endpoint enabled

SNYK_CC_TF_86.impact: HTTP basic authentication is supported by the latest GKE version, potentially allowing secret passwords to be stored in the state file
SNYK_CC_TF_86.issue: The basic authentication is not disabled
SNYK_CC_TF_86.title: GKE Basic Auth is enabled

SNYK_CC_TF_87.impact: The client certificate authentication methods is considered legacy and increase the attack surface for the cluster
SNYK_CC_TF_87.issue: The client certificate authentication is not disabled
SNYK_CC_TF_87.title: GKE client certificate auth is enabled

SNYK_CC_TF_88.impact: The Pods cannot be constrained with PodSecurityPolicies, which increases the security management overhead
SNYK_CC_TF_88.issue: The PodSecurityPolicy controller is not enabled on the cluster
SNYK_CC_TF_88.title: GKE PodSecurityPolicy controller is disabled

SNYK_CC_TF_89.impact: Node verification will be disabled which increases the attacker's ability to impersonate a node in the cluster
SNYK_CC_TF_89.issue: The Shield GKE feature is not enabled
SNYK_CC_TF_89.title: GKE Shield is disabled

SNYK_CC_TF_90.issue: The IAM permission is directly assigned to user account
SNYK_CC_TF_90.resolve: Do not include users in `members` attribute
SNYK_CC_TF_90.title: IAM permission assigned to user

SNYK_CC_TF_91.impact: Open egress can be used to exfiltrate data to unauthorized destinations, and enable access to potentially malicious resources
SNYK_CC_TF_91.issue: The security group rule allows open egress
SNYK_CC_TF_91.resolve: Set `destination_ranges` attribute to specific net addresses e.g. `192.168.0.0/16`
SNYK_CC_TF_91.title: GCP Compute Firewall allows open egress

SNYK_CC_K8S_1.impact: Compromised container could potentially modify the underlying hosts kernel by loading unauthorized modules (i.e. drivers).
SNYK_CC_K8S_1.issue: Container is running in privileged mode
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.1 Minimize the admission of privileged containers
SNYK_CC_K8S_1.resolve: Remove `securityContext.privileged` attribute, or set value to `false`
SNYK_CC_K8S_1.title: Container is running in privileged mode

SNYK_CC_K8S_10.impact: Container could be running with full administrative privileges
SNYK_CC_K8S_10.issue: Container is running without root user control
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.5 Ensure sensitive host system directories are not mounted on containers
SNYK_CC_K8S_10.title: Container is running without root user control

SNYK_CC_K8S_11.impact: UID of the container processes could clash with host's UIDs and lead to unintentional authorization bypass
SNYK_CC_K8S_11.issue: `RunAsUser` value is set to low UID
SNYK_CC_K8S_11.title: Container's UID could clash with host's UID

SNYK_CC_K8S_12.impact: Might cause unexpected network connectivity issues
SNYK_CC_K8S_12.issue: hostAliases is set with custom mapping
SNYK_CC_K8S_12.title: Container is running with custom hosts file configuration

SNYK_CC_K8S_13.impact: Containers will be able to communicate with host's shared channels. This breaks container security boundary.
SNYK_CC_K8S_13.issue: The pod is sharing host's IPC namespace
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.16 Ensure that the host's IPC namespace is not shared
SNYK_CC_K8S_13.resolve: Remove `hostIPC` attribute, or set value to `false`
SNYK_CC_K8S_13.title: Container is running in host's IPC namespace

SNYK_CC_K8S_14.impact: Containers will be able to access host's networking resources. This breaks container security boundary.
SNYK_CC_K8S_14.issue: The pod is sharing host's Network namespace
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.9 Ensure that the host's network namespace is not shared
SNYK_CC_K8S_14.resolve: Remove `hostNetwork` attribute, or set value to `false`
SNYK_CC_K8S_14.title: Container is running in host's Network namespace

SNYK_CC_K8S_15.impact: This allows access to any traffic to the Node Security Group(s), potentially meaning everyone can access your service.
SNYK_CC_K8S_15.issue: Defining a Load balancer Service without setting the loadBalancerSourceRanges property will use the default value of 0.0.0.0/0.
SNYK_CC_K8S_15.resolve: Set `loadBalancerSourceRanges` attribute value to specific IP addresses
SNYK_CC_K8S_15.title: Service does not restrict ingress sources

SNYK_CC_K8S_16.impact: Pods will be able to run with `privileged` mode.
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.1 Minimize the admission of privileged containers
SNYK_CC_K8S_16.resolve: Remove `privileged` attribute, or set vault to `false`
SNYK_CC_K8S_16.title: Policy allows `privileged` containers

SNYK_CC_K8S_17.impact: Pods will be able to run with `allowPrivilegeEscalation` set to true (default value).
SNYK_CC_K8S_17.issue: Privilege escalation is not explicitly forbidden via `allowPrivilegeEscalation` attribute
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.5 Minimize the admission of containers with allowPrivilegeEscalation
SNYK_CC_K8S_17.title: Policy allows privilege escalation

SNYK_CC_K8S_18.impact: All containers will be allowed to escalate privileges, unless `allowPrivilegeEscalation` attribute is enforced to `false`
SNYK_CC_K8S_18.issue: Default privilege escalation control is set to `false`
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.5 Minimize the admission of containers with allowPrivilegeEscalation
SNYK_CC_K8S_18.title: Policy sets insecure default privilege escalation control

SNYK_CC_K8S_19.impact: Containers will be able to enumerate and interact with host's processes. This breaks container security boundary
SNYK_CC_K8S_19.issue: Policy does not prevent containers from running processes inside of host's PID namespace
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.2 Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host process ID namespace
SNYK_CC_K8S_19.resolve: Remove `hostPID` attribute, or set value to `false`
SNYK_CC_K8S_19.title: Policy allows sharing of host's PID namespace

SNYK_CC_K8S_2.impact: Access to docker socket from container can lead to container escape attacks and privilege escalation on the host
SNYK_CC_K8S_2.issue: Docker socket has been mounted inside the pod
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.31 Ensure that the Docker socket is not mounted inside any containers
SNYK_CC_K8S_2.title: Container is running with docker socket mount

SNYK_CC_K8S_20.impact: Containers will be able to communicate with host's shared channels. This breaks container security boundary.
SNYK_CC_K8S_20.issue: Policy does not prevent containers from running processes inside of host's IPC namespace
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.3 Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host IPC namespace
SNYK_CC_K8S_20.resolve: Remove the `hostIPC` attribute, or set value to `false`
SNYK_CC_K8S_20.title: Policy allows sharing of host's IPC namespace

SNYK_CC_K8S_21.impact: Containers will be able to access host's networking resources. This breaks container security boundary.
SNYK_CC_K8S_21.issue: Policy does not prevent containers from running processes inside of host's Network namespace
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.4 Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host network namespace
SNYK_CC_K8S_21.resolve: Remove `hostNetwork` attribute, or set value to `false`
SNYK_CC_K8S_21.title: Policy allows sharing of host's Network namespace

SNYK_CC_K8S_22.impact: Pods will be able to run with root UID.
SNYK_CC_K8S_22.issue: Policy explicitly allows `RunAsAny` user which allows container to run in root UID context
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.6 Minimize the admission of root containers
SNYK_CC_K8S_22.resolve: Set `runAsUser` to `MustRunAsNonRoot`, or exclude UID `0` from `MustRunAs` range
SNYK_CC_K8S_22.title: Policy does not prevent use of root user

SNYK_CC_K8S_23.impact: The pods will be allowed to add any capability at runtime, including SYS_ADMIN
SNYK_CC_K8S_23.issue: The whitelist of allowed capability is set to all
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.8 Minimize the admission of containers with added capabilities
SNYK_CC_K8S_23.resolve: Remove `allowedCapabilities` attribute, or set value to `[]`
SNYK_CC_K8S_23.title: Policy allows all capabilities

SNYK_CC_K8S_24.impact: Pods will be allowed to run with too many permissions, including RAW network resource access
SNYK_CC_K8S_24.issue: Default insecure capabilities are not restricted
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.7 Minimize the admission of containers with the NET_RAW capability
SNYK_CC_K8S_24.title: Policy does not restrict default capabilities

SNYK_CC_K8S_25.impact: This can expose the sensitive endpoints to the wider range of threat actors.
SNYK_CC_K8S_25.issue: All ingress sources are allowed access
SNYK_CC_K8S_25.title: Policy does not restrict ingress sources

SNYK_CC_K8S_26.impact: This can allow the compromised container to exfiltrate information
SNYK_CC_K8S_26.issue: Traffic to all destinations is allowed
SNYK_CC_K8S_26.title: Policy does not restrict egress destinations

SNYK_CC_K8S_27.impact: Pods will be able to run with root GID
SNYK_CC_K8S_27.issue: Policy explicitly allows `RunAsAny` group which allows container to run in root GID context
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.6 Minimize the admission of root containers
SNYK_CC_K8S_27.resolve: Set `runAsGroup` to `MustRunAs` to range which does not include GID `0`
SNYK_CC_K8S_27.title: Policy does not prevent use of root group

SNYK_CC_K8S_28.impact: Pods will be able to start with seccomp disabled.
SNYK_CC_K8S_28.issue: Seccomp profile whitelist contains insecure entries
SNYK_CC_K8S_28.title: Policy allows insecure seccomp profiles

SNYK_CC_K8S_29.impact: Containers will run with seccomp disabled
SNYK_CC_K8S_29.issue: Default seccomp profile is set to `unconfined`
SNYK_CC_K8S_29.title: Policy sets insecure default seccomp profile

SNYK_CC_K8S_3.impact: Containers will be able to enumerate and interact with host's processes. This breaks container security boundary
SNYK_CC_K8S_3.issue: The pod is sharing host's PID namespace
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.15 Ensure that the host's process namespace is not shared
SNYK_CC_K8S_3.resolve: Remove `hostPID` attribute, or set value to `false`
SNYK_CC_K8S_3.title: Container is running in host's PID namespace

SNYK_CC_K8S_30.impact: The containers will be allowed to mount any type, and source of volumes. This can lead to information disclosure and privilege escalation.
SNYK_CC_K8S_30.issue: All volume types are allowed, including `hostPath`
SNYK_CC_K8S_30.resolve: Set value to specific volume types, or remove the attribute
SNYK_CC_K8S_30.title: Policy allows all volume types

SNYK_CC_K8S_31.impact: Pods will run with AppArmor disabled by default
SNYK_CC_K8S_31.issue: Default profile name is set to `unconfined`
SNYK_CC_K8S_31.title: Policy allows any apparmor profile

SNYK_CC_K8S_32.impact: AppArmor will not enforce mandatory access control, which can increase the attack vectors.
SNYK_CC_K8S_32.issue: The AppArmor profile is not set correctly
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.1 Ensure that, if applicable, an AppArmor Profile is enabled
SNYK_CC_K8S_32.title: Container is running without AppArmor profile

SNYK_CC_K8S_33.impact: SELinux mandatory access controls may be bypassed, due to clashes in labeling.
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.2 Ensure that, if applicable, SELinux security options are set
SNYK_CC_K8S_33.title: Container is running with custom SELinux options

SNYK_CC_K8S_34.issue: SSH port is declared in `ports` attribute
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.6 Ensure sshd is not run within containers
SNYK_CC_K8S_34.title: Container is exposing SSH port

SNYK_CC_K8S_36.impact: Increases the attack surface of the application and the container.
SNYK_CC_K8S_36.issue: Container is declaring more than 2 listening ports
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.8 Ensure that only needed ports are open on the container
SNYK_CC_K8S_36.title: Container is running with multiple open ports

SNYK_CC_K8S_37.impact: Increases the attack surface, and can lead to privilege escalation
SNYK_CC_K8S_37.issue: Host's `/dev` path has been mounted inside the pod
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.17 Ensure that host devices are not directly exposed to containers
SNYK_CC_K8S_37.title: Container is running with host device path mount

SNYK_CC_K8S_38.impact: Shared volumes can overwrite data on the host, and are considered dangerous.
SNYK_CC_K8S_38.issue: Bidirectional volume mount propagation has been set
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.19 Ensure mount propagation mode is not set to shared
SNYK_CC_K8S_38.resolve: Remove `mountPropagation` attribute, or set value to `None`
SNYK_CC_K8S_38.title: Container is running with shared mount propagation

SNYK_CC_K8S_4.impact: Containers without memory limits are more likely to be terminated when the node runs out of memory
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.10 Ensure that the memory usage for containers is limited
SNYK_CC_K8S_4.title: Container is running without memory limit

SNYK_CC_K8S_41.impact: Kubernetes will not be able to detect if application is able to service requests, and will not restart unhealthy pods
references: CIS Docker Benchmark v1.2.0 - 5.26 Ensure that container health is checked at runtime
SNYK_CC_K8S_41.title: Container is running without liveness probe

SNYK_CC_K8S_42.impact: The container may run with outdated or unauthorized image
SNYK_CC_K8S_42.issue: The image policy does not prevent image reuse
references: 5.27 Ensure that Docker commands always make use of the latest version of their image
SNYK_CC_K8S_42.title: Container could be running with outdated image

SNYK_CC_K8S_43.impact: External IPs can be abused to perform man in the middle attacks on the service
SNYK_CC_K8S_43.issue: The service has specified the use of an external IP address. CVE-2020-8554
SNYK_CC_K8S_43.title: Service is using an external IP

SNYK_CC_K8S_44.impact: The use of wildcard rights grants is likely to provide excessive rights to the Kubernetes API.
SNYK_CC_K8S_44.issue: The role uses wildcards, which grant the role permissions to the whole cluster
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.7.0 - 5.1.3 Minimize wildcard use in Roles and ClusterRoles
SNYK_CC_K8S_44.resolve: Set only the necessary permissions required
SNYK_CC_K8S_44.title: Role with too wide permissions

SNYK_CC_K8S_45.impact: The use of default service account is discouraged
SNYK_CC_K8S_45.issue: A binding was found between a role and the default service account
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.7.0 - 5.1.5 Ensure that default service accounts are not actively used.
SNYK_CC_K8S_45.resolve: Create specific service account instead of using the default one
SNYK_CC_K8S_45.title: RoleBinding to the default service account

SNYK_CC_K8S_46.impact: Using default role give over permissive permissions
SNYK_CC_K8S_46.issue: A binding was found using one of the default roles
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.7.0 - 5.1.1 Ensure that the cluster-admin role is only used where required.
SNYK_CC_K8S_46.resolve: Create specific role with only the required permissions
SNYK_CC_K8S_46.title: Binding using a pre-defined role

SNYK_CC_K8S_47.impact: Using this role grants dangerous permissions
SNYK_CC_K8S_47.issue: A role was found using a dangerous permissions
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.7.0 - 5.1.2 Minimize access to secrets.
CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.7.0 - 5.1.4 Minimize access to create pods.
SNYK_CC_K8S_47.title: Role with dangerous permissions

SNYK_CC_K8S_48.impact: Those namespaces should be used only by cluster operators, and should be treated as sensitive
SNYK_CC_K8S_48.issue: A role was found that grant permission over system reserved namespace (either default or kube-system)
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.7.0 - 5.7.4 The default namespace should not be used.
SNYK_CC_K8S_48.resolve: Consider creating different namespace and use it instead
SNYK_CC_K8S_48.title: Role that grant permissions to system reserved namespace

SNYK_CC_K8S_5.impact: Containers without limits can exceed the capacity of the node, and affect availability/performance of the host and other containers.
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.11 Ensure that CPU priority is set appropriately on containers
SNYK_CC_K8S_5.resolve: Add `resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value
SNYK_CC_K8S_5.title: Container is running without cpu limit

SNYK_CC_K8S_6.impact: Containers are running with potentially unnecessary privileges
SNYK_CC_K8S_6.issue: All default capabilities are not explicitly dropped
SNYK_CC_K8S_6.resolve: Add `ALL` to `securityContext.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities in `securityContext.capabilities.add`
SNYK_CC_K8S_6.title: Container does not drop all default capabilities

SNYK_CC_K8S_7.impact: SYS_ADMIN capability grants the container almost full administrative privileges
SNYK_CC_K8S_7.issue: SYS_ADMIN privileges are assigned to the container
SNYK_CC_K8S_7.title: Container is running with SYS_ADMIN capability

SNYK_CC_K8S_8.impact: Compromised process could abuse writable root filesystem to elevate privileges
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - Ensure that the container's root filesystem is mounted as read only
SNYK_CC_K8S_8.title: Container is running with writable root filesystem

SNYK_CC_K8S_9.impact: Processes could elevate current privileges via known vectors, for example SUID binaries
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.25 Ensure that the container is restricted from acquiring additional privileges
SNYK_CC_K8S_9.title: Container is running without privilege escalation control
